recipe.title: Butter Beans, Paprika and Piquillo Peppers
recipe.introduction: These beans are great in salads. Let the mix cool and then toss through a selection of salad leaves and herbs. Perk up the leaves with a little olive oil and vinegar and some crispy lavash on top.

ingredients.subtitle: Ingredients
ingredients.ingredient: 125 ml (about ½ cup) extra-virgin olive oil, divided
1 Tbsp. dried chile flakes (preferably pul biber)
2 14-oz. cans butter beans or lima beans, drained and rinsed
300g (10 1⁄2-oz.) jarred piquillo peppers, rinsed and sliced

instructions.step: Step 1 In a wide-based pan over a medium heat, caramelize the red onions in 5 Tbsp. of the olive oil for 15 minutes or until they turn golden and soft. Add a little fine salt, the garlic and spices and continue to cook for 2–3 minutes. Add the tomato purée and cook for another minute.
Step 2 Add the beans and sherry vinegar and reduce the liquid by half over a medium heat. Turn the heat off. Add the piquillo peppers and the remaining olive oil and season with salt to serve.
